Nilesh Thali wrote:

> Folks,
> Would greatly appreciate some help here:
> If this is not the right forum, do let me know.
>
> I'd like to take a piece of code and get suggestions on how to do it
> differently:
> Consider a class called ItinBuilder.
> Given a bunch of flight legs, it builds itineraries. Simple enough.
> Except:
> 1. it can have alternate legs e.g going from A to B at different times.
> 2. have to differentiate departing itins from return itins
>     e.g. A-B-C -> departing
>            C-A    -> return
>            C-B-A -> return
> etc. etc.
> To cut a long story short, assume i have put the following methods
> public class ItinBuilder
> {
>     public void buildItins(segment[] segs);
>
>     private sortByDptrDate();
>     private identifyDupeSegs();
>     private createUniqueItins();  // ignores duplicates
>     private createAllItins();        // builds all itins based on the
> unique itins using dupes
> }
>
> So really, a "client" only needs to call buildItins(), but the real work
> happens in the
> private methods which therefore need to be tested.
> Assumption:
> we'd like to keep our tests in a separate package.
>

What might happen if those methods weren't private?

Mike
